smile.feature

Enum NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling>
      • smile.feature.NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling>
    Enclosing class:
    NumericAttributeFeature

    public static enum NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling
extends java.lang.Enum<NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling>
    The types of data scaling.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      LOGARITHM
      Takes logarithms of input data when they contain order-of-magnitude larger and smaller values.
      NONE
      No scaling at all.
      NORMALIZATION
      Normalization scales all numeric variables in the range [0, 1].
      STANDARDIZATION
      Standardization transforms a variable to have zero mean and unit variance.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling NONE
        No scaling at all.

      • LOGARITHM

        public static final NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling LOGARITHM
        Takes logarithms of input data when they contain order-of-magnitude larger and smaller values. Note logarithms are defined only for positive values.

      • NORMALIZATION

        public static final NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling NORMALIZATION
        Normalization scales all numeric variables in the range [0, 1]. If the dataset has outliers, normalization will certainly scale the "normal" data to a very small interval. In this case, the Winsorization procedure should be applied: values greater than the specified upper limit are replaced with the upper limit, and those below the lower limit are replace with the lower limit. Often, the specified range is indicate in terms of percentiles of the original distribution (like the 5th and 95th percentile).

      • STANDARDIZATION

        public static final NumericAttributeFeature.Scaling STANDARDIZATION
        Standardization transforms a variable to have zero mean and unit variance. Standardization makes an assumption that the data follows a Gaussian distribution and are also not robust when outliers present. A robust alternative is to subtract the median and divide by the IQR.
